div.p: Live a healthier, more active life with Fitbit, the top app for tracking all-day activity, workouts and health.

Use this app on its own to track basic activity and runs, or connect with Fitbit’s line of activity trackers and the Aria Smart Scale to get a complete picture of your daily stats—including steps, distance, calories burned, sleep, weight, and more.
GET ACTIVE. TRAIN SMARTER. EAT BETTER. STAY MOTIVATED.

TRACK ALL-DAY ACTIVITY: Track your daily steps and distance right on your smartphone with MobileTrack for iPhone 5s, 6, and 6 Plus. MobileTrack accurately tracks your basic activity when you carry your phone. For more in-depth, all day tracking of stats like calories burned, active minutes, and sleep, pair the app with a Fitbit tracker.

ELEVATE YOUR TRAINING: Track stats and routes for runs, hikes, and walks with MobileRun. See your pace, splits, time, distance and route maps in real time. Record workouts and use the monthly exercise calendar to follow your training program. (Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.)
LOG FOOD: Easily log calories with a credible food database. Use our barcode scanner or use the quick calorie estimator for customized entries.
ACHIEVE YOUR GOALS: Set goals, enter your weight, record your sleep and start a food plan. Then view your progress and track your trends with easy-to-read charts and graphs.
COMPETE WITH FRIENDS: Enlist friends and family to help you reach your goals by sharing stats, joining fitness challenges, direct-messaging each other, and competing on leaderboards.
SYNC WIRELESSLY: Fitbit trackers continuously sync your stats with your iPhone 4S and later to give you real-time access to your progress without plugging in.
OUTSMART YOUR WEIGHT: Connect wirelessly to the Aria Wi-Fi Smart Scale to seamlessly track your weight, activity and more.
Learn more about Fitbit products and services at www.fitbit.com.
Bug fix for not being able to scroll the leaderboard on iOS 9
- Bug fixes
- Bug fixes

Battery Charging
* Receive a notification when your Charge, Charge HR, or Surge is fully charged

Friend Finder
* Find friends more easily with the updated friend finder tab view
* Invite friends to join Fitbit when you create a Challenge. What better way to start a Fitbit friendship?
* View who you’ve invited to Challenges with the new invitation bar

Exercise Sharing
* Capture epic moments and inspire friends with Exercise Photo Sharing
* Take a photo or choose one from your library and share it with your favorite social network
* Each photo is overlaid with your stats from that workout
* Scale and crop your photo to make it look just right

Weight
Redesigned weight screen with better charts, summary of goal progress, and history of weight logs
Added tools to support different kinds of weight goals: weight loss, weight gain, and weight maintenance
Added support for setting a body fat % goal
Added charts showing body fat % over time

Water
Redesigned water screen with a new chart and daily history
Redesigned the water logger and made it accessible from the + button on the dashboard
Bug fixes

Sleep Tracking
* NEW added the ability to set a nightly sleep goal
* NEW redesigned sleep graphs to help you track your progress
* NEW redesigned sleep history to help you compare nights and naps
Improvements
Bug fixes

Challenges
* Celebrate your win in a Challenge with a new trophy and graph
* Push yourself further with the new Personal Record and Goal Streak awards in Challenges
* Easily start a Challenge again with the same friends using Rematch

Quick access to Logging
* Hit the + button at the top of the dashboard for quick access to tracking runs and walks, logging food, weight, and sleep
Bug fixes

Friend Finder via Facebook
Find friends on Fitbit by connecting to Facebook from the Friends tab

Badges
Share badges with friends outside of Fitbit

Food Logging
Easier logging of multiple items that were previously eaten together
Bug fixes

Fitbit Badges
View your badge collection on your profile from the Account tab
View friends' top activity badges on their profiles

- Redesigned graphs and history screens for Steps, Distance, Calories Burned, Floors, and Active Minutes
- Added access to tracker 101 Quick Start Guides from the device settings screens
- Food Plan calories left for the day and realtime in-the-zone gauge are now consistent with the website
- Bug fixes
- Bug fixes

- Add friends by email address
- Bug fixes
Native support for iPhone 6 and 6 Plus displays
Fixed the crash on launch happening to some people in the last update -- please open the app one more time after it crashes!
P.S. We are indeed working on support for the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus displays. Stay tuned!

** This update is crashing for some people. We're working on another update with a real fix. In the meantime, deleting and reinstalling the app will get you back up and running. We're really sorry for letting this bug slip through.

- Fixed a bug causing some incorrect calorie values on the dashboard and in the Food section
- Fixed a crash affecting a small number of users on viewing the leaderboard
- Fixed Active Minutes for Charge, Charge HR, and Surge users

- Fitbit Challenges: Say hello to a new way to stay motivated! Start a challenge with friends and family to see who can get the most steps in a day, workweek or weekend.
- Support for new Fitbit trackers: Charge, Charge HR, and Surge
- Exercise improvements: better calorie burn tracking and analysis
- Food logging: when a scanned barcode isn't found, request the item be added to the database (US only)

Stay motivated with Fitbit Challenges (BETA)
Compete with friends and family in the Daily Showdown, Workweek Hustle and Weekend Warrior
Fixed support for MobileTrack on iPhone 6 and 6 Plus

- Redesigned and improved the steps to set up a Fitbit tracker
- Redesigned screens for steps, distance, floors, active minutes, and calories burned
Redesigned settings for the Aria smart scale

2.3.2
- Improved the barcode scanner to give better feedback when there’s trouble scanning or finding items
- Fixed a bug where the barcode scan button could disappear when using the the US database
- Added Evening Snack and added back Anytime meal options
- Added back ability to use decimal places when creating custom foods
- Improved responsiveness on the Food screen
- Fix for creating custom foods when using an international food database
- Improved performance of starting up the fullscreen interactive graphs

2.3
Track Run Stats in Real Time
New MobileRun lets you use GPS to track your pace and routes during runs, walks, and hikes.

Track Food Faster
Log food quickly with our new barcode scanner, calorie estimator, and expanded food database of more than 350,000 foods (US food database only).

Track Exercise Easier
Record your workouts in seconds and see a monthly exercise calendar to track your goals and progress.

Plus:
- Add a photo to your Fitbit profile
- MobileTrack now syncs even when the app is in the background

2.3.1
Bug fixes

2.3
Track Run Stats in Real Time
New MobileRun lets you use GPS to track your pace and routes during runs, walks, and hikes.

Track Food Faster
Log food quickly with our new barcode scanner, calorie estimator, and expanded food database of more than 350,000 foods (US food database only).

Track Exercise Easier
Record your workouts in seconds and see a monthly exercise calendar to track your goals and progress.

Plus:
- Add a photo to your Fitbit profile
- MobileTrack now syncs even when the app is in the background

Track Run Stats in Real Time
New MobileRun lets you use GPS to track your pace and routes during runs, walks, and hikes.

Track Food Faster
Log food quickly with our new barcode scanner, calorie estimator, and expanded food database of more than 350,000 foods (US food database only).

Track Exercise Easier
Record your workouts in seconds and see a monthly exercise calendar to track your goals and progress.

Plus:
- Add a photo to your Fitbit profile
- MobileTrack now syncs even when the app is in the background
Bug fixes
Italian and Chinese translations

Fixed a bug preventing some users in Japan and Korea from setting their account’s gender
Fixed a rare syncing bug
Improved communication with Fitbit.com
Added support for gathering more troubleshooting info

- Bluetooth bug fixes
- Added community forum links to the Help screen
- Silent alarms can now be set from the device settings screen (just tap on your tracker at the top of the dashboard)
- Localization updates

Fixed a bug where some MobileTrack users saw negative steps.
Fixed silent alarms screen. If you've set up alarms, you'll see them.
Fixed a bug where the app tried to set up syncing even when the tracker or iOS device didn't support Bluetooth Low Energy.
Fixed a bug that prevented a small number of users from logging in.
Fixed a bug where the service status message sometimes incorrectly showed on the dashboard.

The Fitbit app now features MobileTrack which offers basic Fitbit activity tracking directly using your iPhone 5s.
Redesigned Silent Alarms settings. Set, switch, edit, and remove alarms faster than ever.
Set your own custom water goal.
Redesigned profile editor.
Redesigned tracker settings.
Redesigned sign-up and sign-in.
Tap on people in Friend Finder to see their profile.
Swipe on friends on your leaderboard to Cheer, Taunt, or Message.
Tap on tabs to auto-scroll to the top.
Bug fixes
Bug fixes
This 2.0 app update has some big changes and a new look for iOS7 !

1) NEW NAVIGATION: tap directly on the Dashboard to see the details of your activity, sleep, weight, food, and water consumption. Customize the Dashboard by tapping the Edit button at the top of your screen.
2) BETTER SYNCING on iOS 7 in the background, even when the app isn't open. Tap the picture of your tracker on the Dashboard to change sync settings.

- Messages: cheer, taunt, and message your Fitbit friends
- User profiles: tap on friends to see profiles and send messages, and see who they're friends with
- Make new Fitbit friends: invite friends of your friends directly from their user profiles
- Sleep stats: added awake and restless stats on the Sleep tab
- Graphs: rotating your device to landscape to see fullscreen graphs is much faster
- System Status: dashboard alerts now inform you if the Fitbit.com API is ever down or unreachable

1.7.1
-Fixed crashes when logging activities and food
-Fixed landscape weight graph y-axis scaling and value rounding

1.7
-Daily stats now incorporate color to indicate progress toward goals
-Very Active Minutes now shown on the dashboard
-Added graphs for Distance and Very Active Minutes on the activity tab
-Landscape and portrait graphs now include a 1d time view to show activity over the course of each day
-Flex users can now choose which daily goal progress the tracker displays
-Improvements to the signup and setup process
** We're working on a fix for the crash when logging activities. In the meantime, the workaround is to delete and reinstall the app. We're really sorry this bug slipped through!

-Daily stats now incorporate color to indicate progress toward goals
-Very Active Minutes now shown on the dashboard
-Added graphs for Distance and Very Active Minutes on the activity tab
-Landscape and portrait graphs now include a 1d time view to show activity over the course of each day
-Flex users can now choose which daily goal progress the tracker displays
-Improvements to the signup and setup process
- bug fixes

** IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT SYNC on iOS 6.1.x **
If you have any trouble syncing or linking your tracker, please REBOOT your phone and try again

---
- Distance displayed with daily goals
- More detailed data on the Sleep tab
- Find new friends and respond to invitations on the Friends tab
- Food databases for France, Germany, and Spain
- Settings for timezone, food database, country, and units
- Our app went on a diet and is now over 50% smaller!
- Many more improvements under the hood
**We are working to resolve the issues being reported in this version. In the meantime, here are some tips:
- SYNC: for any trouble with tracker sync, please 1) delete the app, 2) restart your phone, 3) re-install the app
- LOGIN: if you have any trouble with login, please email iphone@fitbit.com with the word "login" in the subject

---
- Distance displayed with daily goals
- More detailed data on the Sleep tab
- Find new friends and respond to invitations on the Friends tab
- Food databases for France, Germany, and Spain
- Settings for timezone, food database, country, and units
- Our app went on a diet and is now over 50% smaller!
- Many more improvements under the hood
**IF YOU EXPERIENCE A CRASH AFTER UPDATING, DELETE AND REINSTALL THE APP**

- Distance displayed with daily goals
- More detailed data on the Sleep tab
- Find new friends and respond to invitations on the Friends tab
- Food databases for France, Germany, and Spain
- Settings for timezone, food database, country, and units
- Our app went on a diet and is now over 50% smaller!
- Many more improvements under the hood
-Improved translations for Japanese users

* Adds Japanese as a supported language
* Fixes a bug preventing some users from viewing the previous day's stats

* Fixed crash on Sleep Graph
* Improved Weight Graph appearance
* Various bug fixes

* Full screen graphs now automatically scale to your data
* Fixed bug affecting launch on iPad in landscape orientation
* Fixed several bugs affecting graphs
* Fixed various crashing bugs
* Improved language translations

* Adds support for displaying and logging Sleep Stats and setting Silent Alarms.
* Adds support for iPhone 5.
* Adds support for Setting Up and Syncing the Fitbit One.
* Adds support for step goal and lifetime badge achievement push notifications.
* Adds support for updating firmware on your Fitbit One or Zip.
* Fixes issue with setting times when logging Activities.

* Adds support for Setting Up and Syncing the Fitbit One.
* Adds support for displaying and logging Sleep Stats.
* Adds support for step goal and lifetime badge achievement push notifications.
* Fixes issue with setting times when logging Activities.

* Fixes issue where floors count was often incorrectly displayed as zero.
* Fixes issue where logged weight values could be incorrect.
* Fixes issue where older custom foods did not appear in the app.

# Fixed in 1.4.2 #
* iPhone 4S users with Bluetooth turned off will no longer see a popup when leaving the app.
* Users who experienced a crash on launch after upgrade or logging will now be able to launch the app and log items without crashing.

# New in 1.4 #
* Support for Fitbit Zip. Set up and sync on the go, for iOS devices with Bluetooth Smart (iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, iPod Touch 5th gen, or iPad 3rd gen).
* Activity graphs. See your steps, distance and floors progress - for the past week, month and year!
* Friends. Find out who's the most and least active of your friends in the new leaderboard.
* Customize the dashboard and tabs. Choose which content you want to show on the main screen, and which tabs you want quick access to.

* Support for Fitbit Zip. Set up and sync on the go, for iOS devices with Bluetooth Smart (iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, iPod Touch 5th gen, or iPad 3rd gen).
* Activity graphs. See your steps, distance and floors progress - for the past week, month and year!
* Friends. Find out who's the most and least active of your friends in the new leaderboard.
* Customize the dashboard and tabs. Choose which content you want to show on the main screen, and which tabs you want quick access to.

* Improved weight graphs! Panning and more.
* Customizable Dashboard order.
* Resolution for the 'sync error' problem experienced by some users.
* Other bug fixes.
* Resolve issue where data update would never complete for some users.
* Adds support for French, German, and Spanish languages

# New Features in 1.2 #
* Track your weight and body fat with colorful graphs.
* Manage your Aria scale settings.

# Fixes in 1.2.1 #
* Resolves problem where items manually logged in the app would synchronize to the website using GMT rather than your local timezone.

* Track your weight and body fat with colorful graphs.
* Manage your Aria scale settings.

* Updates Food Plan
* Fixes problem where some foods would only display as "Loading food".
* Fixes problem where initial sync for some users would fail with an error.

Adds:
* Ability to edit custom foods.
* Twitter integration; you can choose to Tweet goal progress and activities you complete.
* 'Contact Support' mechanism to help resolve account issues.

Fixes:
* Dashboard data could sometimes be out of date.
* Some activities would only display as "Loading activity".
* Calorie calculations were sometimes incorrect.
* Crash when user authentication fails.
* Crash when searching for food brands on some devices.
* Many problems that could result in sync failures.
* Updated terms, conditions, and privacy policy for the UK

* Adds support for Fitbit Ultra—number of floors climbed is now displayed on the dashboard.
* Adds support for displaying data with non-English units. (Data is displayed using the units it was logged with).
* Resolves issue some iPhone 3G users had where activities could not be logged.
* Resolves issue where logged meals would not immediately sync up to the web site.
* Increases robustness and reliability of syncing with Fitbit.com
* Resolves issues with initial launch and food logging seen by some iPhone 3G users.
* Allows login with email addresses typed with upper case characters.
Improved reliability. Tested for iOS 5.

Language: English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Simplified Chinese, Spanish
Seller: Fitbit, Inc.
Rating: Rated 4+
Family Sharing: Yes
Requirements: Requires iOS 7.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
Bundle ID: com.fitbit.FitbitMobile
Supports Apple Watch: No
